name: Argovis API
description: Access Argo profiles via API, i.e. temperature, salinity, and BGC data by location. Argo metadata, float trajectory forecasts, gridded fields, weather events are also available through API. Stay tuned for upcoming satellite data and other Earth science datasets. Argovis API returns JSON representation for Argo profiles, platforms and selections, and their metadata. Argovis API returns JSON representation also for other datasets in Argovis. Argo is an international program that deploys free drifting profiling floats distributed over the global oceans, to measure temperature, salinity, pressure in the upper 2,000m of the ocean. Deep Argo is is an extension of the Argo program to measure deeper than 2000m. Biogeochemical (BGC) Argo is an extension of the Argo program to include biogeochemical observations. As of Thursday, August 6, 2020 12:16 AM, Total number of Profiles in Argovis: 2068427; Number of Deep Profiles: 11676; Number of biogeochemical (BGC) Profiles: 148991, Dacs in Argovis: aoml, bodc, coriolis, csio, csiro,incois, jma, kma, kordi, meds, nmdis.   See API calls for Argovis at https://argovis.colorado.edu/api-docs/ and https://argovis.colorado.edu/docs/Argovis_Tutorials.html, along with examples.
keywords: web service,Argo,Float,Oceanography,Climate,Weather Events,Grid,Biogeochemistry,BGC,Ocean,Atmospheric Rivers,Tropical Cyclones,Southern Ocean State Estimate,Trajectory,Data,sea water temperature,salinity,sea water pressure,conductivity,particle back scattering,particle beam attenuation,dissolved oxygen,chlorophyll,chlorophyll-a,dissolved organic matter,sea water,nitrate,sea water turbidity,bisulfide,sea water ph,downwelling irradiance,upwelling irradiance,downwelling photosynthetic
